title: Issue 266
summary: This month there we have posts on Xamarin.Forms Shapes, UI Designs and Snippets to name just a few things.

items.description: Wow, we are already half way through the year. Where does the time go. This month we have some great posts on the new Shapes feature, more WWDC reviews and great Xamarin.Forms posts.
items.description_markdown: Wow, we are already half way through the year.  Where does the time go.  This month we have some great posts on the new Shapes feature, more WWDC reviews and great Xamarin.Forms posts.

items.title: Virtual Events for Xamarin and .NET in July
items.description:
With life gone virtual, there are tons of new ways to take your development skills to the next level! Here are just a few of the amazing online events, streams, and videos to tune into this July.

Virtual Events for Xamarin and .NET in July : Xamarin Blog by Jayme Singleton
items.description_markdown:
With life gone virtual, there are tons of new ways to take your development skills to the next level! Here are just a few of the amazing online events, streams, and videos to tune into this July.

[**Virtual Events for Xamarin and .NET in July : Xamarin Blog**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/virtual-events-july/) by [Jayme Singleton](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/jaymesingleton/)

embedded_links.title: **Virtual Events for Xamarin and .NET in July : Xamarin Blog**

items.title: Skeuomorphic comeback?
items.description:
Will the new Apple Human Interface Guidelines bring back a resurgence in skeuomorphic design? I for one can't wait to get back my leather-bound notepad application icons.

The Comeback of Fun in Visual Design by Michael Flarup
items.description_markdown:
Will the new Apple Human Interface Guidelines bring back a resurgence in skeuomorphic design? I for one can't wait to get back my leather-bound notepad application icons.

[**The Comeback of Fun in Visual Design**](https://applypixels.com/blog/comeback) by [Michael Flarup](https://twitter.com/flarup/)

embedded_links.title: **The Comeback of Fun in Visual Design**

items.title: Simplifying Grids In Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Grids have a delightful new syntax available in Xamarin.Forms 4.7 and it's also supported by everyones favorite Xamarin.Forms extension mFractor.

Simplifying Grids In Xamarin.Forms by Matthew Robbins
items.description_markdown:
Grids have a delightful new syntax available in Xamarin.Forms 4.7 and it's also supported by everyones favorite Xamarin.Forms extension mFractor.

[**Simplifying Grids In Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.mfractor.com/blogs/news/simplifying-grids-in-xamarin-forms) by [Matthew Robbins](https://twitter.com/matthewrdev)

items.title: WWDC 2020 Viewing Guide
items.description:
If you are looking for a summary of the best sessions to watch from WWDC2020, then look no further. Keith Harrison gives you his recommendations.

items.title: Tips and tricks working with Shapes
items.description:
Javier shares some tips and tricks with working with the new Shapes in Xamarin.Forms 4.7. More specifically he provides some tools you can use to visually design shapes.

[Xamarin.Forms] Tips and tricks working with Shapes by Javier Suárez Ruiz
items.description_markdown:
Javier shares some tips and tricks with working with the new Shapes in Xamarin.Forms 4.7.  More specifically he provides some tools you can use to visually design shapes.  

[**[Xamarin.Forms] Tips and tricks working with Shapes**](https://javiersuarezruiz.wordpress.com/2020/06/30/xamarin-forms-tips-and-tricks-working-with-shapes/) by [Javier Suárez Ruiz](https://javiersuarezruiz.wordpress.com/author/javiersuarezruiz/)

embedded_links.title: Xamarin.Forms] Tips and tricks working with Shapes**

items.title: Xamarin.Forms UI Challenges - Pizza Shop
items.description:
Pizza is like the entire food pyramid. And this Xamarin UI Challenge, like our friend the pizza, has lots of delicious ingredients including animations, transitions, custom buttons, fonts and a sprinkle of SkiaSharp. Nom Nom.

Xamarin.Forms UI Challenges - Pizza Shop by Kym Phillpotts
items.description_markdown:
Pizza is like the entire food pyramid. And this Xamarin UI Challenge, like our friend the pizza, has lots of delicious ingredients including animations, transitions, custom buttons, fonts and a sprinkle of SkiaSharp. Nom Nom.

[**Xamarin.Forms UI Challenges - Pizza Shop**](https://kymphillpotts.com/pizza-shop.html) by [Kym Phillpotts](https://kymphillpotts.com/author/kphillpotts)

items.title: Building a Rating Control using Xamarin.Forms Shapes
items.description:
In this blog post Daniel will show how you can use Xamarin.Forms and Shapes to create a rating control without using an external library.

Building a Rating Control using Xamarin.Forms Shapes by dhindrik
items.description_markdown:
In this blog post Daniel will show how you can use Xamarin.Forms and Shapes to create a rating control without using an external library.

[**Building a Rating Control using Xamarin.Forms Shapes**](https://danielhindrikes.se/index.php/2020/06/30/building-a-rating-control-using-xamarin-forms-shapes/) by [dhindrik](https://danielhindrikes.se/index.php/author/dhindrik/)

embedded_links.title: **Building a Rating Control using Xamarin.Forms Shapes**

items.title: Create a Colorful Geometric Background using Xamarin.Forms Shapes
items.description:
Xamarin recently added new functionality for developers to build mobile apps: Xamarin.Forms Shapes. As the name suggest, it allows developers to create shapes without being restricted to rectangles or ellipses.

Create a Colorful Geometric Background using Xamarin.Forms Shapes by Marco
items.description_markdown:
Xamarin recently added new functionality for developers to build mobile apps: Xamarin.Forms Shapes. As the name suggest, it allows developers to create shapes without being restricted to rectangles or ellipses.

[**Create a Colorful Geometric Background using Xamarin.Forms Shapes**](https://marcofolio.net/geometric-xamarin-forms-shapes/) by [Marco](https://marcofolio.net/author/marco/)

embedded_links.title: **Create a Colorful Geometric Background using Xamarin.Forms Shapes**

items.title: Xamarin Forms OTP verification
items.description:
OTP verification is a 2 Factor authentication which adds extra layer of security. Samir shares setting this up using Twillio and Xamarin.Forms.

Xamarin Forms OTP verification Twilio – Welcome to Xamarin Guy Show Blog by samirgc
items.description_markdown:
OTP verification is a 2 Factor authentication which adds extra layer of security. Samir shares setting this up using Twillio and Xamarin.Forms.

[**Xamarin Forms OTP verification Twilio – Welcome to Xamarin Guy Show Blog**](https://xamaringuyshow.com/2020/07/01/xamarin-forms-otp-verification-twilio/) by [samirgc](https://xamaringuyshow.com/author/samirgc/)

embedded_links.title: **Xamarin Forms OTP verification Twilio – Welcome to Xamarin Guy Show Blog**

items.title: Two Cards Transition Control
items.description:
Charlin tackles creating a control that shows two elements (cards) stacked on top of each other and animate switching between them.

items.title: MFractor for Windows | The Xamarin Show
items.description:
This week, James is joined by Matthew Robbins from the MFractor team who shows off the brand new version of MFractor with Windows support! MFractor adds several features so you can make great Xamarin and Xamarin.Forms apps faster.

MFractor for Windows | The Xamarin Show by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
This week, James is joined by Matthew Robbins from the MFractor team who shows off the brand new version of MFractor with Windows support! MFractor adds several features so you can make great Xamarin and Xamarin.Forms apps faster.

[**MFractor for Windows | The Xamarin Show**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/MFractor-for-Windows--The-Xamarin-Show) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/Niners/JamesMontemagno)
